metadata.title: CVE-2022-42719 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free in the mac80211 stack when parsing a multi-BSSID elementin the Linux kernel 5.2 through 5.19.x before 5.19.16 could be used byattackers (able to inject WLAN frames) to crash the kernel and potentiallyexecute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-52-generic - 5.15.0-52.58
linux-image-5.15.0-52-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-52.58
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-52-generic - 5.15.0-52.58
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-52-generic-64k - 5.15.0-52.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1020-kvm - 5.15.0-1020.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1022-aws - 5.15.0-1022.26
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-52-lowlatency - 5.15.0-52.58
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-52-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-52.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-oracle - 5.15.0-1021.27
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1020-oem - 5.17.0-1020.21
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1017-raspi - 5.15.0-1017.19

No subscription required

backport-iwlwifi-dkms - 9858-0ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-52.58').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.24').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.26').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.27').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.27').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1021.28').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1019.23').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1007.10').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.20').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.23').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-52.58').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1021.27').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1020.21').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.19').
backport-iwlwifi-dkms package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9858-0ubuntu3.1').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws-6.2 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-lowlatency-hwe-6.2 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gcp-6.2 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
